name: Hope Townsend
label: Computational Biologist
summary: I am a Computational biologist driven by the fervent belief that biological understanding can be advanced through the transformative power of computational and statistical methods. In my current research, I focus on using and developing computational tools to integrate disease-associated variation with transcriptomics data for identifying biomarkers of disease. As an interdisciplinary researcher, I am constantly looking for opportunities to advance scientific knowledge and improve public health and scientific knowledge

research.title: Predictive Modeling of Cancer Treatment
research.summary: Working with Drs. Aaron Clauset and Benjamin Bitler from the Computer Science department and Medical School, respectively to identify biomarkers for Ovarian Cancer Treatment Success
highlights: Collaborate with Biostatistics student to develop machine learning algorithm to align multiple transcriptomic platforms (RNA-seq, Nanostring)
Curate the largest public database of ovarian cancer patient data pre and post NACT
Preprocess data (QC, mapping, counting, normalization) for application to a network-based predictive analysis of biomarkers for successful treatment

research.title: Improved Biomarker prediction with Enhancers
research.summary: Collaborating with biologists, clinicians, and data scientists to improve statistical prediction of COPD and Asthma biomarkers using RNA sequencing data and genomics
highlights: Created a Nextflow pipeline and an algorithm for optimized characterization of enhancers from high-throughput sequencing: Github Repo
Developed an enrichment-based statistical method to improve identification of differentially transcribed enhancers and responsive transcription factors: Github Repo
Adapted a novel Bayesian model-based software to model enhancer transcription
Performing QC, enhancer identification, differential expression and GO analysis, and regulatory network prediction of patient samples perturbed with particulate matter
Two expected publications: Townsend et al. in prep (expected May 2025), Townsend et al. in prep (expected Nov 2025)

research.title: Grad Rotation: Single cell omics & GWAS integration
highlights: Benchmarked 3 computational methods for identifying pathologically relevant cell types and gene networks from scRNA-seq/CITE-seq and genome-wide association studies (GWAS)
Evaluated the impact of SNP-gene linking methods on cell-state – disease linkage
Applied statistical modeling to characterize myeloid phenotypes in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Applied a deep learning model to cluster more nuanced cell types by integrating scRNA-seq with pathway data
Github Repo

research.title: Large scale enhancer annotation and RNA Pol II modeling
highlights: Optimized Nextflow pipeline for analysis and QC of high-throughput sequencing data: Github Repo
Curated and characterized set of 800k predicted cis-regulatory elements from an in-house database of run-on sequencing data (>3k samples)
Alpha-tested and optimized Bayesian statistical model of RNA polymerase activity: Github Repo
Benchmarked differential transcription computational methods for identifying differentially transcribed cis-regulatory elements
Applied several machine learning methods to determine target genes of enhancers from correlation of nascent transcription
Applied statistical modeling to characterize myeloid phenotypes in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Applied a deep learning model to cluster more nuanced cell types by integrating scRNA-seq with pathway data

research.title: Predicting Structural Variants without Reference Genomes
highlights: Showed the feasibility of predicting structural variants in species with poor reference genomes by aligning short-read data to high-quality long read data
Created a python-based pipeline to predict structural variants from short read data of individuals to the long read data of another individual
Proved feasibility with proper structural variant divergence in 1000Genomes individuals of varying genomic divergence: Github Repo

research.title: Photosynthesis Redesign
highlights: Gold Medal (requiring excellence in engineering, human practices, & other areas)
Nominee for Awards: Best Plant Synthetic Biology and Best Food & Nutrition Project
Organized and spearheaded a diverse team of 12 to develop a genetically engineered microbe and create products ranging from a website, presentations, to outreach
Guided the team in developing alternative Calvin cycle pathways and performed Gibson assembly to clone synthetic pathways into cyanobacteria
Used Matlab and Python to edit and create scripts for Flux Balance Analysis and in silico growth analysis of multiple developed models
Team Website

research.title: Acinetobacter baumannii
highlights: Coordinated with PhD candidate on projects investigating the photoreceptor BlsA in Acinetobacter baumannii, focusing on its regulon at 24ºC and 37ºC
Performed RNA isolation, cDNA generation, qRT-PCR and RNAseq differential expression analysis using Linux, Python & R at 24ºC & 37ºC
Developed mutants with regards to multiple genes of interest using point mutation mutagenesis and recombineering protocol including the design of primers and cloning
Conducted and edited biological and immunological assays to measure light-mediated activities (motility, conjugation, catalase activity, murine model, etc.)

interests.name: Teaching Others about Bioinformatics
interests.summary: I help lead a workshop every year teaching graduate students on how to perform QC on and analyze their next-generation sequencing data (e.g. CITE-seq, RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq)

interests.name: Throwing fun events to give parents a break
interests.summary: I plan and lead a quarterly Kid's Night Out event where myself and fellow volunteers entertain and feed around 30 kids with fun learning activities!
